text: Nevado Tres Cruces is a massif in the Andes range, in Argentina and Chile. It has two peaks. One is Trace Cruces Sur at , which is the 6th highest mountain in the Andes. The other is Tres Cruces Centro at . Nevado Tres Cruces is a volcano, but has not been active for a long time. The first people to reach the top of the highest peak (Trace Cruces Sur) were Stefan Osiecki and Witold Paryski, in 1937 == References == Category:Mountains of Argentina Category:Volcanoes of Chile Category:Andes Category:Catamarca Province
title: Nevado Tres Cruces
